results.definition: a genus of haws comprising the harriers
a frenetic disorganized (and often comic) disturbance suggestive of a large public entertainment
examples: it was so funny it was a circus

results.definition: an arena consisting of an oval or circular area enclosed by tiers of seats and usually covered by a tent
examples: they used the elephants to help put up the circus

results.definition: (antiquity) an open-air stadium for chariot races and gladiatorial games
a performance given by a traveling company of acrobats, clowns, and trained animals
examples: the children always love to go to the circus

results.definition: a travelling company of entertainers; including trained animals
examples: he ran away from home to join the circus
